s.text: The WP carries an AP story inside stating that the man who used the Internet last spring to accuse the Navy of shooting down TWA Flight 800 is now saying that action was "reckless and a mistake."

The paper points out that the bill, which includes such taxpayer protections as shifting the burden of proof to the government in tax disputes and the creation of a civilian oversight board, will likely be even further strengthened by the Senate.
The piece goes on to point out that in the past three years, CIA officers have been caught spying in, and kicked out of, at least four other countries: Germany, France, Italy and India.
The NYT runs a story inside reporting that a U.S. intelligence official, "apparently a CIA officer," has left Austria after being caught wiretapping the phone of a North Korean diplomat.
The piece goes on to point out that in the past three years, CIA officers have been caught spying in, and kicked out of, at least four other countries: Germany, France, Italy and India.

USA Today leads with the chief U.N. weapons inspector's suspicions that Iraq has been tampering with his surveillance cameras in his team's absence.
